entry.title: [GRA11][Public Cloud] - Software upgrades
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jun 24, 08:00 UTC  -  Jun 25, 12:00 UTC

May 23, 08:17 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Public Cloud offer.


This may temporarily affect availability.


Start time : 24/06/2024 08:00 UTC
End time : 25/06/2024 12:00 UTC
Service impact : Services offline on targeted hosts for at least 15 minutes
Service improvement : As part of our continuous infrastructure improvement plan, we need to apply software upgrades on some hosts.


We advise that due to the non-mitigable nature of H100 instances, it is necessary to execute the upgrades while active customers are utilizing these hosts.

An individual communication will be sent to impacted customers.

Please be informed that during the maintenance period, the instances assigned to the targeted hypervisors will experience temporary disruption as a consequence. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in this matter, as we continue to improve our services.

entry.title: [GLOBAL][Storage] - Object Storage maintenance notification
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jun 10, 07:00 UTC  -  Jun 18, 19:00 UTC

May 27, 12:33 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Object Storage offer.

Start time : 10/06/2024 07:00 UTC
End time : 18/06/2024 19:00 UTC
Service impact : Unless a specific storage class configuration is in place on your software, no impact is to be expected.
If not, please refer to our dedicated page for storage class correspondence by offer.
Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy of our service, we will be rolling out an update for Object Storage.
The objective of this maintenance is to enable customers to address all our storage classes on a single .io endpoint, while ensuring backward compatibility with the current operation of your tools via the .perf endpoint.
The maintenance will take place in 2 stages:
- The first one will be the 10/06/2024 from 07:00 UTC till 16:00 UTC.
- The second one will be the 17/06/2024 from 07:00 UTC till 16:00 UTC.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [GRA3/5/7/9/11][Public Cloud] - Network maintenance notification
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jun 4, 20:00 UTC  -  Jun 5, 03:00 UTC

May 16, 10:20 UTC
Scheduled - This maintenance may temporarily affect Latency.

Start time : 04/06/2024 20:00 UTC
End time : 05/06/2024 03:00 UTC
Service impact : None. Except in rare case latencies can be noted to reach PCI instances running
Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy of our products and services, we will carry out a network hardware upgrade in our Graveline Datacenters
The operation is carried out in several steps:

-Step 1: Preparation of the operation (about 3 hours)
-Step 2: New hardware implementation (about 2 hours)
-Step 3: Test and activation of the new hardware (about 2 hours)

The critical phase of this upgrade is tentatively scheduled between 11:00 PM UTC and 1:00 AM UTC. We are not expecting any impact. However in case of an issue the rollback can be managed in less than 30 minutes.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [EU][Public Cloud] - Management incident notification
entry.content:
May 28, 14:08 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 20/03/2024 16:18 UTC
End time : 07/05/2024 15:20 UTC
Related incident : Incident link
Service impact : Adding a new region or local zone through the manager for the Public Cloud offer was failing
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Apr 19, 15:27 UTC
Update - Our team is still working on this incident.
Update on service impact: When adding a new region through the manager, you may experience errors up to 10 minutes when navigating in the manager. After maximum 10 minutes, the issue will be automatically resolved.

Future changes are coming to mitigate the problem. These changes are currently in testing phases and will be deployed as soon as possible.

Apr 9, 13:54 UTC
Update - Our teams are preparing a patch to mitigate this issue.
Maintenance notifications will be sent.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused.

Mar 21, 14:26 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Mar 20, 19:23 UTC
Update - After a deep investigation by our technical teams, they found that local zones can be added by submitting a request from the manager, but will take more time than expected.
Our technical teams are currently preparing a fix to resolve the latency problem and the error message displayed on the manager which does not represent the actual status of the request.

Mar 20, 17:46 UTC
Identified - Start time : 20/03/2024 16:18 UTC
Service impact : Adding a new region or local zone through the manager for the Public Cloud offer may fail
Related incident : Incident link
Ongoing actions : Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

entry.content:

End time : 17/04/2024 15:00 UTC

Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Update - Service impact : WAW region is unavailable on APIv6 and Manager to avoid errors 500.
Update : Our teams are always investigating. The region will remain unavailable over the weekend to avoid errors 500 on the APIv6 and the Manager.
The region remains available on the Openstack and Horizon APIs.
